Checks that the formula can be parsed

acceptable_formula.Rd

Uses an S3 method to check that a given formula can be parsed based on its class. It currently scans for contrasts that are not supported and in-line functions. (e.g: lm(wt ~ as.factor(am))). Sine this function is meant for function interaction, as opposed to human interaction, a successful check is silent.

acceptable_formula(model)

Arguments

model

An R model object

Examples


model <- lm(mpg ~ wt, mtcars)
acceptable_formula(model)

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Examples

tidypredict is a part of the tidymodels ecosystem, a collection of modeling packages designed with common APIs and a shared philosophy.
